intro: Relbunium bigeminum, commonly known as the twin-flowered bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Relbunium bigeminum is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
